summary: This executive order suspends the duty-free de minimis treatment for all countries, which allows for the importation of goods valued below a certain threshold without incurring tariffs. summary: This executive order establishes the 'Department of Government Efficiency' initiative aimed at optimizing the federal workforce to enhance productivity and reduce waste. It is expected to streamline operations across various agencies, leading to improved service delivery and cost savings.

title: Eliminating the Federal Executive Institute
summary: This executive order mandates the elimination of the Federal Executive Institute, which is responsible for training federal executives. The expected impact includes a reduction in federal training resources for leadership development, potentially affecting the quality of executive training within the federal government.

title: Ending Procurement and Forced Use of Paper Straws
summary: This executive order aims to terminate the mandatory procurement and use of paper straws across federal agencies. It is expected to reduce costs and improve operational efficiency by allowing agencies to choose alternative materials that may be more suitable for their needs.

title: Pausing Foreign Corrupt Practices Act Enforcement To Further American Economic and National Security
summary: This executive order pauses the enforcement of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) to enhance American economic interests and national security. The order aims to provide U.S. businesses with greater flexibility in international markets by reducing regulatory burdens associated with foreign bribery laws.

title: Addressing Egregious Actions of the Republic of South Africa
summary: This executive order addresses specific actions taken by the Republic of South Africa that are deemed egregious by the U.S. government. It outlines measures to hold accountable those responsible and aims to mitigate the impact of these actions on U.S. interests.

title: Establishment of the White House Faith Office
summary: This executive order establishes the White House Faith Office to enhance the engagement of faith-based organizations in federal programs and initiatives. It aims to foster collaboration between the government and religious communities to address social issues and improve community welfare.
agencies_affected: Department of Health and Human Services
Department of Housing and Urban Development

title: Protecting Second Amendment Rights
summary: This executive order aims to reinforce and protect the rights granted under the Second Amendment of the U.S. Constitution. It is expected to impact gun ownership regulations and enhance the legal framework surrounding firearm rights.
agencies_affected: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

title: Eradicating Anti-Christian Bias
summary: This executive order aims to address and eliminate perceived anti-Christian bias within federal policies and practices. It seeks to ensure that Christian beliefs and practices are respected and protected in various sectors, potentially impacting how federal agencies interact with religious organizations.
agencies_affected: Department of Health and Human Services

title: Imposing Sanctions on the International Criminal Court
summary: This executive order imposes sanctions on the International Criminal Court (ICC) in response to its actions perceived as undermining U.S. sovereignty and interests. The expected impact includes restricting financial transactions and travel for ICC officials, thereby limiting the court's operational capacity.

title: Keeping Men Out of Women's Sports
summary: This executive order aims to establish regulations that prohibit individuals assigned male at birth from participating in women's sports at various levels. The expected impact includes reinforcing gender-specific categories in athletics and addressing concerns regarding fairness and safety in women's sports.

title: Amendment to Duties Addressing the Synthetic Opioid Supply Chain in the People's Republic of China
summary: This executive order amends existing duties related to the synthetic opioid supply chain originating from the People's Republic of China. It aims to enhance regulatory measures and impose stricter tariffs to combat the influx of synthetic opioids, thereby addressing public health concerns and reducing opioid-related fatalities.

title: Withdrawing the United States From and Ending Funding to Certain United Nations Organizations and Reviewing United States Support to All International Organizations
summary: This executive order mandates the withdrawal of the United States from specific United Nations organizations and terminates funding to these entities. It also initiates a review of U.S. support for all international organizations, potentially reshaping the country's foreign policy and international relations.

title: Progress on the Situation at Our Northern Border
summary: This executive order addresses the ongoing situation at the northern border of the United States, outlining measures to enhance border security and improve immigration processes. It aims to streamline operations and ensure a coordinated response among federal agencies to manage border-related challenges effectively.

title: Progress on the Situation at Our Southern Border
summary: This executive order addresses the ongoing challenges at the U.S. southern border, outlining measures to enhance border security and improve immigration processes. It aims to streamline operations and foster cooperation among federal agencies to manage the situation effectively.

title: A Plan for Establishing a United States Sovereign Wealth Fund
summary: This executive order outlines a comprehensive plan to establish a United States Sovereign Wealth Fund aimed at managing and investing government assets for long-term economic stability and growth. The fund is expected to enhance fiscal resilience and provide a mechanism for funding public initiatives without increasing national debt.

title: Imposing Duties To Address the Situation at Our Southern Border
summary: This executive order imposes duties on certain goods to address the ongoing situation at the southern border of the United States. The expected impact includes increased revenue for border security measures and a potential reduction in the volume of goods crossing the border, aimed at managing immigration and trade more effectively.

title: Imposing Duties To Address the Synthetic Opioid Supply Chain in the People's Republic of China
summary: This executive order imposes duties on imports related to the synthetic opioid supply chain from the People's Republic of China. The aim is to disrupt the flow of synthetic opioids into the U.S. and mitigate the ongoing opioid crisis by targeting the sources of these substances.

title: Imposing Duties To Address the Flow of Illicit Drugs Across Our Northern Border
summary: This executive order imposes duties aimed at curbing the flow of illicit drugs across the northern border of the United States. It is expected to enhance border security and reduce drug trafficking by implementing economic measures against certain goods associated with drug smuggling.

title: Unleashing Prosperity Through Deregulation
summary: This executive order aims to reduce regulatory burdens across various sectors to stimulate economic growth and enhance business operations. It is expected to promote investment and innovation by streamlining compliance requirements and removing unnecessary regulations.

title: Additional Measures To Combat Anti-Semitism
summary: This executive order aims to implement additional measures to combat anti-Semitism in the United States. It seeks to enhance protections against anti-Semitic acts and promote awareness and education regarding anti-Semitism, thereby fostering a more inclusive society.

title: Celebrating America's 250th Birthday
summary: This executive order establishes a framework for the national celebration of America's 250th birthday in 2026. It aims to promote unity and civic engagement through various events and initiatives across the country.

title: Ending Radical Indoctrination in K-12 Schooling
summary: This executive order aims to eliminate what is perceived as radical indoctrination in K-12 education across the United States. It seeks to implement guidelines and policies that promote a more balanced educational curriculum, potentially impacting teaching practices and educational content in public schools.

title: Expanding Educational Freedom and Opportunity for Families
summary: This executive order aims to enhance educational choices for families by promoting policies that increase access to various educational options, including charter schools and school vouchers. The expected impact includes greater parental control over education and improved educational outcomes for students.

title: Protecting Children From Chemical and Surgical Mutilation
summary: This executive order aims to prohibit chemical and surgical procedures that are deemed harmful to children, particularly in the context of gender transition. It seeks to protect minors from undergoing irreversible medical interventions, thereby promoting a policy of safeguarding children's health and well-being.
agencies_affected: Department of Health and Human Services

title: The Iron Dome for America
summary: This executive order establishes a domestic defense initiative modeled after Israel's Iron Dome, aimed at enhancing the United States' missile defense capabilities. It is expected to bolster national security by providing advanced protection against aerial threats.

title: Prioritizing Military Excellence and Readiness
summary: This executive order aims to enhance the operational readiness and overall excellence of the U.S. military forces. It outlines strategic initiatives to improve training, resources, and support for military personnel, thereby ensuring a more effective defense posture.

title: Reinstating Service Members Discharged Under the Military's COVID-19 Vaccination Mandate
summary: This executive order aims to reinstate service members who were discharged due to non-compliance with the military's COVID-19 vaccination mandate. The expected impact includes restoring personnel to active duty and addressing staffing shortages within the military.

title: Restoring America's Fighting Force
summary: This executive order aims to enhance the readiness and capabilities of the U.S. military by implementing measures to recruit, retain, and support service members. It is expected to strengthen national security and improve the overall effectiveness of the armed forces.

title: Council To Assess the Federal Emergency Management Agency
summary: This executive order establishes a council tasked with assessing the effectiveness and operational capabilities of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA). The council aims to identify areas for improvement and enhance the agency's response to emergencies, thereby increasing overall national preparedness.

title: Emergency Measures To Provide Water Resources in California and Improve Disaster Response in Certain Areas
summary: This executive order aims to implement emergency measures to enhance water resource management in California and improve disaster response capabilities in specific regions. It is expected to address immediate water shortages and bolster the state's resilience to natural disasters.

title: Enforcing the Hyde Amendment
summary: This executive order aims to reinforce the Hyde Amendment, which prohibits federal funding for abortions except in certain circumstances. The expected impact includes stricter enforcement of existing policies regarding federal funding and potential changes in how related services are administered.
agencies_affected: Department of Health and Human Services

title: Removing Barriers to American Leadership in Artificial Intelligence
summary: This executive order aims to enhance the United States' position in the field of artificial intelligence by removing regulatory and bureaucratic obstacles. It is expected to foster innovation, attract investment, and ensure that the U.S. remains a leader in AI technology.
agencies_affected: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Office of Science and Technology Policy

title: Declassification of Records Concerning the Assassinations of President John F. Kennedy, Senator Robert F. Kennedy, and the Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
summary: This executive order mandates the declassification of records related to the assassinations of President John F. Kennedy, Senator Robert F. Kennedy, and Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. The expected impact is to enhance public access to historical documents and promote transparency regarding these significant events in U.S. history.

title: President's Council of Advisors on Science and Technology
summary: This executive order establishes the President's Council of Advisors on Science and Technology to provide expert advice on science, technology, and innovation policy. The council aims to enhance the federal government's ability to leverage scientific research and technological advancements for national benefit.
agencies_affected: Office of Science and Technology Policy

title: Strengthening American Leadership in Digital Financial Technology
summary: This executive order aims to enhance the United States' position in the digital financial technology sector by promoting innovation, ensuring regulatory clarity, and fostering collaboration among stakeholders. It is expected to drive economic growth and improve the competitiveness of American financial services on a global scale.

title: Designation of Ansar Allah as a Foreign Terrorist Organization
summary: This executive order designates Ansar Allah, a Yemeni militant group, as a Foreign Terrorist Organization (FTO). This designation is expected to enhance U.S. efforts to combat terrorism and may lead to increased sanctions and restrictions on individuals and entities associated with Ansar Allah.

title: Revocation of Certain Executive Orders
summary: This executive order revokes specific previous executive orders that are deemed outdated or no longer necessary. The expected impact includes streamlining government operations and eliminating redundant policies.

title: Ending Illegal Discrimination and Restoring Merit-Based Opportunity
summary: This executive order aims to eliminate illegal discrimination in federal hiring and contracting processes, emphasizing a return to merit-based opportunities. It is expected to enhance fairness and equality in employment practices across federal agencies.

title: Initial Rescissions of Harmful Executive Orders and Actions
summary: This executive order rescinds several previous executive orders and actions deemed harmful to public policy. The expected impact includes a shift towards more favorable regulations and policies that align with the current administration's objectives.

title: Restoring Accountability to Policy-Influencing Positions Within the Federal Workforce
summary: This executive order aims to enhance accountability in policy-influencing positions within the federal workforce by establishing clearer standards and oversight mechanisms. It is expected to improve the integrity and effectiveness of federal policy-making processes.

title: Restoring Names That Honor American Greatness
summary: This executive order aims to restore and promote the use of names and symbols that reflect American values and historical significance. It is expected to foster a sense of national pride and unity by emphasizing names that honor American greatness.

title: Application of Protecting Americans From Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act to TikTok
summary: This executive order applies the Protecting Americans From Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act specifically to TikTok, addressing concerns over data privacy and national security related to foreign ownership. It aims to mitigate risks posed by foreign adversaries controlling applications that may threaten American users' data.

title: Clarifying the Military's Role in Protecting the Territorial Integrity of the United States
summary: This executive order clarifies the responsibilities and limitations of the military in safeguarding the territorial integrity of the United States. It aims to ensure that military actions are aligned with constitutional principles and civil authority, thereby reinforcing the balance between national security and civil liberties.

title: Defending Women From Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government
summary: This executive order aims to counter what is described as 'gender ideology extremism' by reaffirming biological definitions of sex within federal policies. It is expected to impact various federal programs and policies related to gender and women's rights, potentially reshaping the landscape of gender-related regulations.
agencies_affected: Department of Health and Human Services

title: Reforming the Federal Hiring Process and Restoring Merit to Government Service
summary: This executive order aims to reform the federal hiring process by reinstating merit-based principles and reducing barriers to entry for qualified candidates. The expected impact includes a more efficient and equitable hiring process that enhances the quality of government service.

title: Protecting the United States From Foreign Terrorists and Other National Security and Public Safety Threats
summary: This executive order aims to enhance national security by implementing measures to prevent foreign terrorist threats and other risks to public safety. It is expected to strengthen the government's ability to identify and mitigate potential dangers posed by foreign entities.

title: Realigning the United States Refugee Admissions Program
summary: This executive order aims to realign the U.S. Refugee Admissions Program to better address current global refugee crises and enhance the efficiency of the admissions process. It is expected to increase the number of refugees admitted while ensuring that the program aligns with national security interests.
agencies_affected: Department of Health and Human Services

title: Restoring the Death Penalty and Protecting Public Safety
summary: This executive order aims to reinstate the use of the death penalty for certain federal crimes, emphasizing its role in enhancing public safety. The order is expected to impact the judicial process and the enforcement of capital punishment at the federal level.

title: Securing Our Borders
summary: This executive order aims to enhance border security measures to prevent illegal immigration and trafficking. It is expected to strengthen enforcement protocols and improve coordination among federal agencies involved in border management.

title: Putting America First in International Environmental Agreements
summary: This executive order aims to prioritize U.S. interests in international environmental agreements by reassessing existing commitments and ensuring that they align with national priorities. The expected impact includes a shift in how the U.S. engages with global environmental policies, potentially leading to renegotiations or withdrawals from certain agreements.

title: Reevaluating and Realigning United States Foreign Aid
summary: This executive order aims to reassess and adjust the framework of U.S. foreign aid to ensure it aligns with current geopolitical priorities and national interests. The expected impact includes a more strategic allocation of resources to enhance diplomatic relations and address global challenges effectively.

title: Declaring a National Energy Emergency
summary: This executive order declares a national energy emergency in response to significant disruptions in energy supply. It aims to mobilize federal resources and coordinate efforts to stabilize energy markets and ensure the availability of essential energy resources.

title: Designating Cartels and Other Organizations as Foreign Terrorist Organizations and Specially Designated Global Terrorists
summary: This executive order designates certain cartels and organizations as foreign terrorist organizations and specially designated global terrorists. The expected impact includes enhanced legal and financial measures against these entities, aimed at disrupting their operations and reducing their influence.

title: Establishing and Implementing the President's 'Department of Government Efficiency'
summary: This executive order establishes the Department of Government Efficiency, aimed at streamlining federal operations and enhancing the effectiveness of government services. The expected impact includes improved efficiency in government processes and better service delivery to the public.

title: Protecting the American People Against Invasion
summary: This executive order aims to enhance national security measures to protect the American populace from perceived threats of invasion. It is expected to implement stricter immigration controls and bolster border security efforts.

title: Protecting the Meaning and Value of American Citizenship
summary: This executive order aims to reinforce the significance of American citizenship by establishing policies that promote civic engagement and discourage actions that undermine the value of citizenship. It is expected to enhance the understanding and appreciation of citizenship among residents and citizens alike.

title: Ending Radical and Wasteful Government DEI Programs and Preferencing
summary: This executive order aims to eliminate government programs related to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) that are deemed radical and wasteful. The expected impact includes a reduction in federal spending on DEI initiatives and a shift in government policy towards merit-based practices.

title: Holding Former Government Officials Accountable for Election Interference and Improper Disclosure of Sensitive Governmental Information
summary: This executive order aims to establish accountability measures for former government officials involved in election interference and the unauthorized disclosure of sensitive governmental information. It is expected to enhance the integrity of electoral processes and protect national security by deterring misconduct among former officials.

title: Unleashing Alaska's Extraordinary Resource Potential
summary: This executive order aims to enhance the development and utilization of Alaska's natural resources, promoting economic growth and energy independence. It is expected to streamline regulatory processes and encourage investment in resource extraction and infrastructure.

title: Unleashing American Energy
summary: This executive order aims to enhance domestic energy production by streamlining regulations and promoting investment in energy infrastructure. It is expected to boost the U.S. economy by creating jobs and reducing energy costs for consumers.

title: America First Policy Directive to the Secretary of State
summary: This executive order directs the Secretary of State to prioritize America First principles in foreign policy decisions, emphasizing national interests and economic benefits. It aims to reshape diplomatic engagements to better align with domestic priorities and enhance national security.

title: Withdrawing the United States From the World Health Organization
summary: This executive order initiates the process for the United States to withdraw from the World Health Organization (WHO). The expected impact includes a significant shift in U.S. global health policy and potential repercussions on international health collaboration and funding.
agencies_affected: Department of Health and Human Services
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Ending the Weaponization of the Federal Government
summary: This executive order aims to prevent the misuse of federal government resources for political purposes, ensuring that federal agencies operate without bias or undue influence. It is expected to enhance public trust in government operations and promote accountability among federal officials.

title: Restoring Freedom of Speech and Ending Federal Censorship
summary: This executive order aims to restore and protect the freedom of speech by prohibiting federal agencies from engaging in censorship practices. It is expected to impact the way federal entities interact with social media platforms and other communication channels, potentially leading to increased transparency and accountability.

title: Partial Revocation of Executive Order 13961
summary: This executive order partially revokes Executive Order 13961, which may alter the existing policies or directives established under that order. The expected impact includes a shift in the regulatory framework or operational guidelines for the affected areas.

title: Helping Left-Behind Communities Make a Comeback
summary: This executive order aims to revitalize communities that have been historically underserved and economically disadvantaged. It focuses on providing resources and support to foster economic growth, improve infrastructure, and enhance quality of life in these areas.
agencies_affected: Department of Housing and Urban Development
